answers.answer:
Ukrainian children can enroll in schools or kindergartens by contacting the County Schools Inspectorates, submitting an application, and then being assigned to a group or class after the application is analyzed.

To find detailed information, including contact details for County Schools Inspectorates and application forms, refer to the sections "How to enroll a child in school, kindergarten or extracurricular activities" and "I want to enroll my child in school" on the webpage. For information on Ukrainian-specific educational options, look under "Ukrainian schools and kindergartens in Romania" or visit the dopomoha.ro/en/education website.

answers.answer:
To enroll a child in extracurricular activities in Romania, first contact the County Schools Inspectorates, then fill out and submit the application form either physically or online via email. The application will be analyzed within one day, after which the responsible Commission will contact you to decide on your child's placement in a group or class.

To find more detailed information, please navigate to the webpage containing this summary and look for the section titled "How to enroll a child in school, kindergarten or extracurricular activities," specifically under the sub-section "I want to enroll my child in extracurricular activities."

To find more detailed information, please navigate to the webpage containing this summary and look for the section titled "How to enroll a child in school, kindergarten or extracurricular activities," specifically under the sub-section "I want to enroll my child in extracurricular activities." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/education

answers.answer:
Ukrainian students can continue their university studies in Romania by directly contacting the university they wish to attend. They may enroll based on a statement of responsibility regarding previous studies, even without immediate documents, though each university has its own procedure, and diplomas must be presented before completing studies.

To find detailed information, please refer to the section titled "If you are or have been a student and you want to continue your studies in Romania: Continuing your studies" within the provided text.
answers.bResponse:

They may enroll based on a statement of responsibility regarding previous studies, even without immediate documents, though each university has its own procedure, and diplomas must be presented before completing studies.

To find detailed information, please refer to the section titled "If you are or have been a student and you want to continue your studies in Romania: Continuing your studies" within the provided text. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/education

answers.answer:
Yes, Ukrainian students can enroll in Romanian universities even if they do not have all their academic documents, based on a statement on their own responsibility regarding previous studies. However, each university has its own procedure for evaluating enrollment.

To find more detailed information, go to the webpage and read under the section "Continuing your studies".
answers.bResponse:

To find more detailed information, go to the webpage and read under the section "Continuing your studies". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/education

answers.answer:
To recognize foreign diplomas for further studies or employment in Romania, you need to contact the National Center for Diploma Recognition and Equivalence (CNRED) under the Ministry of Education, which evaluates and recognizes study papers upon submission of a complete file. For further studies, you can also directly approach the university where you wish to enroll.

To find detailed information, go to the webpage and look under the section titled "I have completed my studies" and "Steps you need to follow."
answers.bResponse:
To recognize foreign diplomas for further studies or employment in Romania, you need to contact the National Center for Diploma Recognition and Equivalence (CNRED) under the Ministry of Education, which evaluates and recognizes study papers upon submission of a complete file. For further studies, you can also directly approach the university where you wish to enroll.

To find detailed information, go to the webpage and look under the section titled "I have completed my studies" and "Steps you need to follow." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/education

answers.answer:
The National Center for Diploma Recognition and Equivalence (CNRED) is responsible for the equivalence of foreign studies and diplomas in Romania.

To find more detailed information, go to the provided text and read under the section titled "Equivalence of studies."
answers.bResponse:
The National Center for Diploma Recognition and Equivalence (CNRED) is responsible for the equivalence of foreign studies and diplomas in Romania.

To find more detailed information, go to the provided text and read under the section titled "Equivalence of studies." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/education

answers.answer:
To apply for diploma recognition in Romania, you generally need to submit an application, a copy of your high school diploma/certificate and school situation for the last two years of studies (with certified translations if not in Romanian, English, French, Spanish, or Italian), a copy of your personal identification documents, and pay an evaluation fee (unless you benefit from international protection). Depending on the issuing country, documents may also require apostille or superlegalization.

You can find the detailed list of required documents under the section "I have completed my studies" and then "Steps you need to follow" in the provided text. Look for "Step 1: Set up the file".
answers.bResponse:
To apply for diploma recognition in Romania, you generally need to submit an application, a copy of your high school diploma/certificate and school situation for the last two years of studies (with certified translations if not in Romanian, English, French, Spanish, or Italian), a copy of your personal identification documents, and pay an evaluation fee (unless you benefit from international protection). Depending on the issuing country, documents may also require apostille or superlegalization.

You can find the detailed list of required documents under the section "I have completed my studies" and then "Steps you need to follow" in the provided text. Look for "Step 1: Set up the file". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/education

answers.answer:
Yes, there is an evaluation fee of 100 RON for the recognition of foreign diplomas, but this fee is not paid by individuals who benefit from a form of international protection.

To find this information on a webpage, navigate to the section titled "I have completed my studies" and then look under "Steps you need to follow," specifically "Step 1: Set up the file."
answers.bResponse:
Yes, there is an evaluation fee of 100 RON for the recognition of foreign diplomas, but this fee is not paid by individuals who benefit from a form of international protection.

To find this information on a webpage, navigate to the section titled "I have completed my studies" and then look under "Steps you need to follow," specifically "Step 1: Set up the file." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/education

answers.answer:
The evaluation process for diploma recognition typically takes a maximum of 30 working days from the date of registration of a complete file, though this deadline may be extended if further checks are required.

You can find this detailed information in the summary under the section "I have completed my studies" and then "What's next?".

Ukrainian minors under temporary protection in Romania are eligible for free accommodation in school dormitories, a daily food allowance, and additional financial support for school supplies, bedding, clothing, and footwear.

To find this information, go to the webpage and look under the section titled "Accommodation and Allowances for Ukrainian Minors".

To find the detailed schedule and sign up for these courses, visit the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/education` and look under the "Courses and activities for refugees from Ukraine" section.
